Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that only Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were named Time's Person of the Year, not Xi Jinping.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by including Xi Jinping as one of the persons named Time's Person of the Year, when in fact he was not.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on photoshopped images and fake covers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photoshopped images and fake covers are accurate representations of Time magazine's actual cover.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide an alternative explanation.
